website_summaries.verdict: There's nothing fancy about it, but if you want a traditional rubber mallet with a classic design, this is the one to buy.
pros: A fairly sturdy rubber mallet manufactured by one of the most trusted names in tools
Has classic design with wooden handle that's basic yet effective
Flexibility for use on variety of surfaces
cons: The rubber tends to chip and dent easily
The rubber has a strong odor at first, which tends to fade over time

customer_reviews.title: Good mallet.  anchors my soccer goal twice a week.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to carry in my soccer bag to hammer down the U-bolt I use to securely anchor the goal. It's a good weight for a small job like that, easy to swing, but powerful enough to drive a small U-bolt into the ground quickly. I like the feel of it in my hand too. One small complaint: a small piece of black rubber came off about the 2nd time I used it, leaving a small scratch in the mallet. It still works just as well, but I was surprised it got cut so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: D. Campisi

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT, USE IT TO KEEP MY WIFE IN LINE
customer_reviews.text: Just kidding... A simple product at a great price and delivered right to my front door.
customer_reviews.author: Donny Brook

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: A rubber mallet is one of my go-to tools, as it serves two purposes. 1) the usual around-the-house tasks that require a rubber mallet. 2) in the kitchen, I use the mallet to pound out things like chicken breasts evenly, or to lightly pulverize things like dried bread or to crack nut shells. I even managed to even out the bottom of a huge second-hand aluminum kitchen kettle that was bulging so much it wouldn't sit flat on the stovetop. Now it sits flat on the stovetop just fine. I always trust tools made by Stanley. They are always well-made and stand the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: Mike The D.

customer_reviews.title: solid rubber mallet
customer_reviews.text: It's a great rubber mallet for a great price. Very solid in every way, which is only 2; the handle and the rubber mallet part. It's heavy, good balance; I'm not sure what the $60 one can do that this $6 one can't. I think I saw a review that said plastic coated and feels cheap? But I saw that as I was closing the tab, so, maybe not? Cause that doesn't make sense. No plastic coating, no cheapness.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Nice Home Mallet
customer_reviews.text: A rubber mallet is a rubber mallet. In other words, there's not much to expect. It is what it is. And this is a rubber mallet. There's a real wooden handle and a real rubber end (I'm sure there are more technical terms). This is the size for most home projects, like pounding down something metal you don't want to dent or scratch. Chrome things, for example. Even wooden things, like furniture, which needs a few light taps. I'm pleased. Anthony Trendl americanspeechwriter.com
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Trendl

customer_reviews.title: Great Mallet!
customer_reviews.text: Never owned a rubber mallet and I am pleased to report that this mallet is actually better than the shelving unit I assembled with it. Much better than I had expected and a perfect price. Wish the shelving unit had been as good. Mallet gets 5-stars and shelving unit gets 2-stars. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: It's good to have a spare.
customer_reviews.text: We had one of these in the house that we used so much, it was always getting misplaced. Now we have one in the downstairs junk drawer, and one in the upstairs tool caddy. I'll probably end up getting one for the gardening shed too. I find myself using this so much more than a regular hammer. It exerts enough force, without being so damaging. Besides, now I have one handy in case the hubby steps out of line ;)
customer_reviews.author: J. Heath

customer_reviews.title: As advertised: It’s a rubber hammer!
customer_reviews.text: I got it to put a metal shelf rack together, worked as expected! Did not break, was well priced, did not damage product either and I used it a few more times ever since. In the end, made a good addition to my ever expending tool collection!
customer_reviews.author: YaroslavTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good for woodworking; can hammer wood joints into place without marking the surface
customer_reviews.text: Great for hammering where you don't want the hammer to leave a mark. I got it to hammer in some dowel joinery on an old table. Great for hitting the leg without marking the surface. Also, with two toddlers around, this has been good to let them hit things with a real tool. I let them destroy cardboard boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Gagewyn

customer_reviews.title: Great Mallet
customer_reviews.text: I find uses for this all the time. I even pounded car break parts with it pretty hard and it's hel up. It also facilitated getting my gf's mother out of the house finally, so there aren't enough stars available to admirably give it...
customer_reviews.author: Ardsley Waxwing

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: The mallet works like a mallet should. Still mad at myself for losing one with light colored mallet head. I've only used this one on items that don't discolor, so not sure if it will leave marks on items.
customer_reviews.author: Tera H.

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars - Total Awesomeness!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this "Stanley 41-104 16 ounce Rubber Mallet," to add to my tool collection. The rubber mallet has a solid white-head; and an absolutely solid, wooden handle. The rubber mallet was at the perfect price point and is worthy of all your tool boxes. I would recommend this rubber mallet to anyone and everyone wanting to expand their tool collection. Once again, my trustworthy Amazon.com delivered an awesome product and delivered it sooner than expected which is always nice.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Kerby

customer_reviews.title: Glad I decided to purchase this item!
customer_reviews.text: I have had multiple surgeries on my arm/hand/wrist and this nifty little tool gives me the strength to open things like the pool filter when my body fails me. It is very durable as it remained outside all summer and did not leave marks when used. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Nibbles2014

customer_reviews.title: Great for home use
customer_reviews.text: Very Sturdy rubber mallet im not a professional carpenter or tool guy but for just the average around the home use this has come in real handy i also always take it camping works great for setting up the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Joseph Oaks

customer_reviews.title: A good tool, but may wear you out
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate the fact that rubber will be lighter weight than a metal mallet. However, this mallet just doesn’t have quite enough oomph to it that I think it could have if it were a bit heavier.
customer_reviews.author: Javantavius

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it for the price
customer_reviews.text: Have done quite a bit of banging with this since I got it. No complaints especially for the low price.
customer_reviews.author: J.S.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap and excellent for my purpose (opening and closing a metal cover on a pool filter.) Amazon had this mallet at half the price a similar mallet would have cost elsewhere, which is a good deal on a product that will only be used for three minutes once or twice a week.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Quality Rubber Mallet
customer_reviews.text: Heavy weight quality hard rubber mallet. Trusted name in tools and quality made. Perfect for "hammering" on material you don't want to leave marks on. Smooth finished handle.
customer_reviews.author: John Gabbert

customer_reviews.title: Wack
customer_reviews.text: It's a rubber mallet. There's not much to say, is there? It's a low-cost version, so it isn't pretty, but it whacks thinks nicely and that's all one really needs from a rubber mallet.
customer_reviews.author: N. Helfinstine

customer_reviews.title: Useful. Good size and weight.
customer_reviews.text: It works. Hasn't fallen apart and I've used it quite a bit, mostly with putting together shelves and entertainment consoles, but have used it in the kitchen for pounding chicken breasts too. Very inexpensive when I bought it. Good deal.
customer_reviews.author: LittleBig Hart

customer_reviews.title: it's sturdy rubber mallet
customer_reviews.text: Well, it's sturdy rubber mallet, and it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Moussassa

customer_reviews.title: Good Mallet
customer_reviews.text: It's just a cheap rubber mallet and it does what it needs to without breaking. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Rajnovich

customer_reviews.title: Stanley Quality
customer_reviews.text: What you’d expect from Stanley. Quality, well made, solid rubber. 16 oz is perfect weight for my general uses. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Grandpa Tommy

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Good weight on the end. Survived pounding in edging all around the home and the new trees we put in.
customer_reviews.author: KaseyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Feels sturdy, but rubber wears down
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy mallet for its size. Feels nice and sturdy. I used it to drive in 24 stakes, and the edges of the rubber are already wearing down.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Yeah it's a solid rubber mallet
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for thumbtacks! whew saves quite the headache or Thumbache lol
customer_reviews.author: FamilyGuy

customer_reviews.title: It's a mallet. I hit things with it, ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a mallet. I hit things with it, and they move. When I hit things, it does not break or hit me back, so we get along well.
customer_reviews.author: A. Snively

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I use it regularly to pound in plastic stakes in my front yard for my kids' various activities. Both the stakes and the mallet are holding up just fine!
customer_reviews.author: Tom Hallman

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for. Works as expected ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. Works as expected. I used it to hammer in plastic edging in my garden.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Solid quality
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction and works well. Works a lot better than the cheap rubber mallets I used to buy from dollar and discount stores.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lai

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Chemical Smell....
customer_reviews.text: The Gavel itself is great and is exactly what I needed BUT the horrible SMELL will overwhelm you if you are anywhere near it... It's super strong and awful!!
customer_reviews.author: Holly M.

customer_reviews.title: It's a good sturdy mallet, that seems like I'll have forever!
customer_reviews.text: It's a good sturdy mallet, that seems like I'll have forever! The design & quality are what I'd hope for... I haven't used it yet...still waiting for an opportunity to use it..I'll let you know if there's any problems...but I don't think so!!
customer_reviews.author: travelgirl

customer_reviews.title: I ordered this to pound and crush regular size granola ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to pound and crush regular size granola bars (in its wrapper) to put into my yogurt rather than purchasing the already crumbled granola which tends to be pricey. This works well! I'm sure I will find other ways to use it in my kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: MDW

customer_reviews.title: Well made Rubber Mallet
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made bargain! I used it today and was pounding a door jamb very hard with it and my shoulder doesn't even hurt. And of course the door jamb was not marred. The price is great.

customer_reviews.title: Memories
customer_reviews.text: Part of a shower gift for my grandson and his bride....evokes memories of him as a little guy helping Grandpa lay a brick patio.

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should
customer_reviews.text: It's a rubber mallet... It's got a handle and a rubber head. They're put together well. Not a complicated tool, but still useful. :)

customer_reviews.title: It's a rubber mallet. Yes it smells, it's ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a rubber mallet. Yes it smells, it's rubber. Keep it in your toolbox and you won't have a problem

customer_reviews.title: Works well for tent stakes. Haven't used it for ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well for tent stakes. Haven't used it for anything as of else yet. Handle seems well made but is slippery with moisture.

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: I use it for light jobs and it hasn't failed me yet

customer_reviews.title: Never thought it'll be a great buy judging from the reviews I've read about this ...

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Husband likes it to help chop wood and not ruin his hatchet. He doesn't have any complaints. Does what it's supposed to do.

customer_reviews.title: Love Owning a Mallet
customer_reviews.text: Why did I wait do long to buy a mallet? This thing is perfectly balanced. Nice wooden handle and solid squishy-hard rubber head. Exactly like the one my Dad owned. Recommended.

customer_reviews.title: Good and useful
